caption: Excellent burgers and cannolis!

I went to ABC Pony two times since I have come to DC. The dinner for two specials are to die for! I wish they would come back. The burgers are wonderful and the fries are mouth watering. The tea and beverage selection is great, but it would be wonderful if you were open on Sundays. I want my ABC Pony 7 days a week!!! I have been drooling at the thought of trying one of the cannolis but have been too lazy to leave my room to go get one. Will try again!
ABCPony’s fusion food is bold, tasty, and innovative. I loved the juicy, flavorful Peking duck and sides during Thanksgiving.
I had a burger and fries here the other day. I was very satisfied with burger and the fries. The customer service was great. I am excited to eat here more often.

ABC Pony’s burger menu was such a surprise and delight! I ordered “The Eby” and it had everything I wanted in a burger. The Ceaser-Fried Brussel Sprouts were amazing and an item I would order on its own. Lastly, the fries were so good that we didn’t need any condiments to enjoy them!  Looking forward to more yummy and creative food items from ABC Pony.
Great restaurant! I love the uniqueness of the food. Great vibe, food and cocktails!
I love ABC Pony. They bring a cool vibe to both the food and atmosphere and provide a nice selection of updated classics.
ABC Pony is phenomenal. Erik Bruner-Yang and Armani Johnson have done an amazing job of constantly reinventing the classics into a fun culinary experience.
Excellent food. Had the dinner for two special. Can’t beat it!

I am not sure how to put this, but I recently had a burger here (the eby) and it was like that burger some how managed to set off a chain reaction. The taste, smell, and texture of the burger made me go through so many emotions. It was a roller coaster ride I didn't want to get off.  The music of this place transports you in time to the good ole' rap days.  Charles and the other workers there are always friendly and willing to help make your experience at ABC Pony, enjoyable. If you are looking for great food, in an amazing location, with an unparalleled ambience, look no further.

This place is a hidden gem. It’s the perfect date night, quick bite, late night, or place to go if you want food prepared with intention and creativity.  The first I came here, I was my family when they just opened. We were looking for a quick drink-EBY was behind the bar and offered to make us drinks and was so nice and personable. He made me a kamikaze shot (thanks) and I’ve been hooked on the drinks (great HH) ever since!  The burgers are incredible, the staff is incredible, and the location in our apartment is great. Definitely check it out!
ABC Pony is the best! Their chef, Armani, is making some of the most interesting food in the city right now.
Love this place - awesome food, great plant based options, and reasonable price.

ABC pony is a great restaurant with great vibes and even better food! Their food is made to order so you know it will always be fresh. The fried chicken on the menu is probably the best I’ve had. Their food is Asian & Italian—a combination that I have never tried before or heard of but consists of very delicious and fun to eat food. Currently they are doing a burger pop up and the burgers are insanely tasty! The chefs are almost always there and making sure everyone is enjoying themselves which is just a very genuine touch and makes the dining experience much more personal and intimate. Highly recommend—and their Happy Hour menu with 5$ cocktails is the best!

I don’t even know where to start with this restaurant. The service is amazing and the food is immaculate. Whether it’s well thought out meals, weekly deals on fresh doughnuts, or the subtle cocktail confections, there is no better restaurant for your $! We eat here once a week and will continue to for the foreseeable future.
By far some of the best and most innovate food in the area and the staff is super friendly and helpful!  Their pop-up burgers are some of the best I've ever had, especially love the EBY!
The fact that I could order a Gluten Free bun at ABC Pony makes them the best in the area right now! Try the brussels sprouts and lumpias as sides dishes. Won't disappoint!
Some of the best burgers I’ve ever had! All around amazing food and cocktails.
The food here is innovative and super tasty. The cocktails fit the same bill. This place has become my go to!
Great Place! The menu is diverse with lots of great options. The environment and staff are welcoming. Would recommend this to anyone!
Great environment and great menu!
The food is absolutely wild. Huge fan.

ABC Pony is by far my favorite restaurant in the area! The wings are legitimately some of, if not the best in the city. I've loved everything they've done from doughnuts to their burgers! Best of all, the staff is always so kind and friendly.

Great restaurant and cocktails! Their food menu is unique and delicious. Their weekly specials are something to look forward to. I highly recommend ABC PONY to either for a great dinner or happy hour.
Burger Pop Up at ABC Pony has been incredible! The Nashville Hot Wings and Brussel Sprouts are extremely good too. Keep this going!
The burger pop-up at ABC Pony has been going for a few weeks now, and has been delicious! Quality food and ingredients for a good price. Definitely will be back!
The ABC burgers and fries pop up has been delicious!
Love that ABC Pony is always adding new things to the menu and trying out new concepts--the burger pop-up has been incredible! Highly recommend the EBY burger!

They currently have a Thursday through Sunday burgers & beer theme (not sure if it’s a pop up or abc pony but they’ve been there for a few weeks). Really good burgers with gourmet toppings. Sides are quality and for the fries and sprouts come in a large portion size. Highly recommend! Pro tip: my order was ready 5 mins before pickup time so might just want to get there a couple minutes early if you order online.  Currently appears to be takeout only which is nice during the pandemic.
The Burger pop up has been wonderful and ABC Pony has pulled it off perfectly.
Dirty tables

Best happy hour (and service) in DC! Craft cocktails and daily pasta made in house that are all delicious. The staff will make you feel like part of the family. Make sure to check out their Instagram for other specials and weekly meal specials.

ABC Pony might be one of my favorite restaurants in DC. Born in the Philippines and raised in a first generation Italian family, I was used to lumpia and pancit for dinner one night, and pasta with homemade sauce the next. So this place felt like a little slice of home, but elevated. I had the pleasure of dining in when they opened and am thankful for the take-out option they offer in these COVID times. The only bit on constructive criticism I have stems from my most recent experience.  We had made reservations for the New York Strip Steak dinner special, which included 2 starters, entree with a side of pasta, and dinner. We arrived and the staff informed us that they would fire up our order since they had just sold out (pro tip: head to Instagram to view their weekly dinner specials and call ahead to reserve, just in case they sell out at the time of your dine-in reservation). Having dined previously, we knew we ALSO wanted to order the lumpia & try the crab dip on top of our pre-ordered dinner special. After we had placed our order, we received lumpia, soup, cucumber & shrimp salad, steak, noodles, crab dip over and tiramisu over the course of 37 minutes. Now, I understand in these unprecedented times, there are time limits for dining in. However, that was neither verbalized when we arrived nor communicated when we made the reservations online, and I’m not so tone deaf as to think I’d be able to dine leisurely. The food was absolutely phenomenal and can’t speak highly enough of chef Armani Johnson, but the lack of thought behind timing and coursing out of the menu to our table slightly rained on the dine-in experience.
Great spot
Liked the simple fact that the Bruthas was on point with True info.

Honestly I used to live in the building and they screwed up every order I have ever made. That’s saying something with a year long track record. Icing on the donut was I once ordered an orange cream donut — they served me one with filling I was allergic to. Exhausting to pretend it’s as good as they say. Go to fifty other places like shilling or Osteria Morini — they don’t mess up orders and take exorbitant time to make them in the first place.

Visit 1-As a vegetarian, I was a bit disappointed with the selection. The egg drop soup sounded great but apparently was made w chicken broth so it was a no go for us. We had the artichoke salad which was tasty but nothing that would bring me back. We had the tomato confit w bread which the waiter definitely oversold. It tasted like diced tomatoes out of the can. The bread was delicious though and clearly high quality olive oil. We had the 2 vegetarian pasta dishes, the tagliatelle and the agnolotti. The tagliatelle was incredible and I would go back just to have 2 of that dish and nothing else. Literally if that was the only thing I had tonight, 5 stars. After splitting those 3 dishes, we were still hungry and ordered the agnolotti. It was way too sweet for a main dish. Was not a fan at all.--BRING BACK THE TAGLIATELLE  Visit 2: The Cereal-Flavored Doughnuts! YUMMMMM  Visit 3: Heirloom Tomato Salad-that aioli was scrumptious Eggplant Cavatelli- don't normally go for eggplant but the pasta was amazing last time and was the only veg option. It was delicious! Almond Doughnut-warm and filled with almond cream. HOLY HELL! Creamsicle Doughnut-not as good as the almond but very nostalgic

username: m i c h a e l

caption: Amaaaazing donuts and super freaking tasty espresso. The man who was working on Tuesday (8/08/2020) morning was super helpful and sweet. Will 100% be coming back!

I've only had amazing food at ABC Pony! The whole staff is incredibly nice and seem to really believe in their work and products. The restaurant is innovative, fun, and clearly care about their community. So glad ABC opened and excited for my next meal with them!
Great food, great atmosphere. Employees have good vibes and the music selection is nice.

Ordered tea-glazed pork belly, eggplant cavatelli, and apple crisp with coconut ice cream, takeaway, for restaurant week. Look at how good the pork belly (with bbq beans and pickled watermelon rind) looks, and that was after (sorry) a bumpy 15 minutes in a takeout container! I meant to take pictures of the rest but we forgot and ate them.  Sweet/salty/funk combos and textural contrasts in just this meal far exceeded this abc's expectations. The dessert wasn't too sweet, either. Idk by what sorcery the ice cream stayed fluffy after I'd re-frozen it once I got home, but that stuff was good.  I've also had their breakfast bowl (savory, creamy gloriousness) and a weekly sandwich special, which that week was a pork belly banh mi (as refreshing as it was filling). Also, always, always get the abc chocolate chip cookie, which is perfectly just shy of too sweet.

The staff was very friendly. Food was delicious! It was restaurant week in DC so we got to sample lots of yummy foods for a reasonable price. Make sure you have the QR code app to view the menu. Bonus points for the 90s R&B/ Rap jams they were playing! 💯🙌🏿😎
The Monday prime rib special is great! Add the shrimp for a complete meal.
Good
I’ve been having the Chicken Breakfast Bao Bun at least once a week 😅 soooo good. Iced coffee is excellent too. Can’t wait to try more food. Friendly staff too.

Just tried DC Pony for the first time and can’t wait for this pandemic ends so we can go back and dine in. We’ve eaten at most DC hot spots and this is blew away our expectations. The egg drop soup and xo sauce noodles were phenomenal.
They have reacted to social distancing really well. They're nightly specials are delicious and they've made take out really easy.
(Translated by Google) Excellent  (Original) Exelente

The egg drop soup was great. It was very flavorful. However, I was not a fan of the spaghetti. In terms of flavor,  it was greasy and extremely fishy. I could only stomach a few bites. Regarding the price, it was a small amount of pasta for the price point.  If I had advise for the restaurant, it would be to add descriptors to the menu. Maybe someone would prefer the spaghetti, but I know I would have ordered something different if I knew it tasted like fish paste.
Couldn't stomach more than a couple bites of the xo sauce spaghetti. Wouldn't recommend. I can't remember the last time I wanted to return a dish.  My SO enjoyed the egg drop soup and fusilli.
This is a really great restaurant!
Great Asian fusion food

When I first heard ABC Pony was opening in my neighborhood, I was excited to try more of Bruner-Yang’s creative dishes.  I tried two of the pasta dishes, the Tagliatelle and the Fusilli, which were both good, but they lacked that “wow” factor that many of his other dishes have.  Again, interesting concept and great atmosphere, but I wasn’t very impressed with the food.  I am however looking forward to their brunch menu, which is supposedly coming soon.
Great concept and well executed. We enjoyed everything we ordered and the service was phenomenal.

The food here is great. But they have an odd rule — single people are only allowed to sit at the bar. Even if they have plentiful empty small tables and there is no wait, no line. I would normally be happy to sit at the bar, but at 5pm on a weekday the small bar is full. Being told I had to wait for a bar stool because I was a party of 1 was a bit depressing. So my sad single Liz Lemon self will have to limit my visits to off-hours...
Didn't know if I would like it but everything was amazingly good...definitely a must

Wow. This place is phenomenal, both food and service. We tried every dish here and the “must orders” are pictured below.  Special shout out on the mind blowing egg drop soup. 110% must try. The cheese adds a whole new dimension of umami.
Delicious pasta, great Negroni, nice staff. One of our best DC restaurants in a while!
Really really love this place! The vibe, food, and cocktails were fantastic
My girlfriend and I just had the best pasta of our lives here. Tagliatelle dish is to die for and Fusilli was amazing! I am already excited to go back and I’m in a food coma as I write this.
Food combinations were kind of weird but I'm an old school and prefer a steak over their fish with curry and a side of spaghetti.
I found many of the dishes overly spicy where it overpowered the other flavors of the dish. They were very accommodating to my lactose allergy. Reasonably priced.
Their pasta is amazing, especially the tagliatelle! Great drinks, too!
Very cool atmosphere. Good music, not too loud. Drinks and food were delicious! Definitely going back.
Delicious food!! Even better hospitality!!! Highly recommend!

Interesting place with a bit of a retro vibe, low couches, tiny martinis, wide and low wine glasses, and baby cups for water. I felt like a giant (Andre) at our table.  I typically never ask for anything but dish and beverage requests with pleases and thank yous and let everything play out around me, be that a dance of instruments playing in concert or a cacophony of sound. Our server was kind and tried very hard. With the final pasta dish taking over 45 mins to arrive, unpromted he brought over two comped appetizers. So they're conscientious, to say the least.  The food was a mixed bag. The deep fried crispy cheese filled, marinara sauce dipping sticks were great. Thanks to the server and the long delay of the pasta we had two of these. It's well balanced and loaded with garlic.  I might flatten the crisps in order to enable greater scooping of the sauce.  The second dish (and we had two of these too) was the shrimp. Wowza, the sauce combined with the grated cheese is putrid. If you have one or the other, it's fine but dipping the cheese topped shrimp into the intended sauce triggers an abnormal reaction. The sauce on its own is a little weird. I would say it's a marinara base with chili sauce. Marinara tends to have a slight acidity, but with the chili, it's really weird. Sorry. The shrimp are well cooked and crisp.  I really enjoyed the pasta, pictured below. It was well balanced. A definite reorder.  Overall, I think they may have some issues with timing, but the service puts an effort to counter balance that. The dishes were both great and, ummm, not great. Choose wisely.
This place rocks. Amazing drinks, delicious food, good atmosphere, great service. Hesitant to post because I fear they'll get too crowded, but the success is well-deserved.

Bruner-yang gets it right...again. Small menu in a stylish little space accompanied by creative drinks.  The food and service of our server specifically were about a 4, but management/restaurant service recovery made it a 5. We went on a Saturday night and it wasn't too busy, but there seemed to be only 1-2 individuals actually taking orders. Our server was nice but scatterbrained. She would say she told us things (like a drink was arriving late), but all 4 of us at the table didn't hear it. She didn't bother telling us we could order dishes with extra pieces (i.e. an extra lumpia) until after we received the order. So then one person had to wait for their share of the food. She also forgot our orders and had to repeat them several times. The food was creative and good, per usual with Bruner-yang. The meatball lumpias are absolutely delicious, we had to order another order. The mochi shrimp was so interesting, juicy yet chewy and slightly sweet from the mochi. The caesar salad was more of a cabbage salad, and was just ok - we wouldn't order again. We ended up ordering all the pastas, all of which have perfectly cooked pasta noodles in excellent delicious creative sauces. Beware the XO spaghetti is fishy due to the XO sauce. THe tagliatelle and agnolotti's sauces and flavor combinations were yummy. The fusili was probably our favorite (and apparently our server's too even though she didn't mention it at all until we ordered it later on in the meal). Though I would comment the soppressata was totally unnecessary, the pasta is so good, the cured meat didn't add anything to the dish. The meal had several hiccups, but the kitchen/management really honed in and sent us extra food, comp ice cream for dessert, to make up for the issues. At the end of the day, the restaurant has only been open 2 months, and service recovery is just as important as the meal itself. Thank you ABC Pony for recognizing that. We'll definitely be back!

Different dining experience. Once you get in it comes to you. Chef Chris is out front the owner Chef is the food runner. Chef asked if we had met. Perhaps! But it is a great fusion place that everyone should try. I will be back. Thanks for the grub.

I don’t know how this place has 4.9 stars currently. Maybe I came on a really off night for them but it was not walk-away-craving-more-stellar. Lackluster-tasting food, trying too hard hipster vibe(receipt comes in a cassette tape, and extremely limited dessert selection(vanilla and chocolate ice cream...groundbreaking).  The fried shrimp was the best - to me it was the only dish that had a great taste and texture. The lumpia was fine but not good. I thought Italian restaurants could make al dente pasta but mine was mushy, the only texture in there were the bread crumbs. The dessert options were literally ice cream or poundcake. To top that, the flavors within those said desserts were vanilla, chocolate, cherry, or lemon poundcake. We passed on dessert.  Our server was nice and friendly, same with the staff but I would not recommend this place.

Interesting interiors and good service, but food was unimpressive. The lumpia was tasty and the shrimp were great, but the pasta was inexcusably soggy for an Italian restaurant (albeit fusion). Dessert offerings were slim and boring.
Drinks were great, food was amazing. Definitely worth a trip!
Amazing food and inspirational cocktails. Rob the bar tender was truly incredible.

Had a wonderful time at this asian-italian fusion eatery. To start, our waiter was very knowledgeable and answered all of our questions about the menue in addition to making great suggestions. The cocktails were delicious and affordable for a DC restaurant. The restaurant serves dishes family style. Egg drop soup and lumpia were both delicious starters. Tagliatelle and spaghetti pasta dishes were amazing! Don't leave without trying. Would definitely come back to try the other pasta dishes.
Intrigued with the concept and had a great first visit.  Good food, friendly staff!
Delicious food great service
My new favorite place in Navy Yard. Great food, great atmosphere.  Well done ABC Pony team!

This place was perfect. We had stunning food - the eggplant is not to be missed. We even got extra sauce because it was soooo good. The staff were generous and kind and so welcoming. A perfect four hour lunch!

Super cool place, small menu of really unique and delicious offerings. Loved the cocktails (they were strong and complex, my favorite was the beet negroni). Actually the best bread I've had in DC, and I'm from New York and very picky about my bread. Service was great! Can't wait to go back.
It was ok. I wasn't crazy about the food but we had great service. It seems many others has a great experience so maybe it just wasn't for me.

Amazing food! Try the mochi shrimp and the eggplant for appetizers, any of the pastas- all all really delicious and the ice cream deserts. Chef Eric and Nikki were wonderful hosts! Lovely inviting cozy ambience. Highly recommend

Chef Erik Bruner-Yang strikes again with ABC Pony-- an Asian-Italian restaurant that actually gets fusion right. Let's be honest, it always can be a crapshoot.  DECOR/ AMBIANCE. Attached to an apartment complex, the corner venue harkens to fun nods of the 80s/90s with VHS tapes and stickers hidden amongst the wallpaper-- feel free to search. The ambiance is vibrant and easy, almost effortless. Not pretentious, and not too casual. It's the type of environment where time stops. We were there for four hours (not suggesting you do the same) and lost track of time.  FOOD. The food and drink is inventive. A balance of Italian and Asian nods, but probably a bit more Italian in terms of homemade pasta, imported Italian ice cream, and Italian classics. But where there are standouts is how the Chef incorporates surprises, whether it's the brightness of apples, capers, or Asian spice nods. And then there's Asian inspired dishes such as lumpia filled meatball meat and mochi fried shrimp in spicy tomato sauce. It's both surprising but not too pretentious. Oh the fresh crusty bread is a must. I think we asked for about four refills.  SERVICE. This is where the team shines. From being warmly greeted by Nikki when you enter to the seemingly family of staff (Emmanuel was our server) that kept wine and water glasses full while regaling us in fun conversation. And this was opening weekend. A time that is usually crazy, chaotic, and stress-inducing. And while all of that may have been happening, it was not apparent at all. This team is amazing!  A must go! Five stars.

Unique food that is respectful of and elevates Chinese and Italian cuisine by mixing different elements of each.  Thoroughly and comfortably enjoyed my meal — would recommend the mochi shrimp and XO spaghetti.  Looking forward to another visit!

Fantastic food! Spaghetti with XO sauce is a perfect love affair of Asian and Italian flavors and textures. Comfort food for our souls especially during cold winter. Worth to try their assortment of interesting cocktails. Two main pasta dishes and two drinks $56 dollars. Good price and quality. Cool interior.
Amazing Food. Amazing Atmosphere... what else could you ask for?

The food at this place is legit. The restaurant has a cool, low-key vibe perfect for a date night. My only qualms are that the wait staff was just average and they are limited to only gelato on the dessert menu.  The small plates we ordered were Asian fusion and both were awesome; meatball and burrata lumpia and the crispy shrimp fra diavolo.  Highly recommend the white bolognese and the arriabata tagliatelle, both pastas were amazing.
Excellent  service. Friendly staff. Food was very delicious

ABC Pony is the latest masterpiece by Erik Bruner-Yang. Here why this will become a D.C. favorite:  1) Food: The menu has twelve items on it so you know each and every dish is superb. To start, I had the lumpia. It's burrata and meatballs wrapped with a perfect spicy tomato sauce for dipping. Next, I had the egg drop soup. It's Italy's version of the famous soup and comes with housemade broth full of flavor. To finish, I ordered the artichoke salad with broken pesto and bread crumbs. It's well balanced and tasty.  2) Drinks: They have a healthy beer and wine list. They are developing their cocktail program, but in the meantime have a $10 daily rotating drink. I ordered the "Weekdays at Bernie" with rum, lime, and honey. I ordered two and wanted a third. One of the most affordable quality cocktails in the city.  3) Atmosphere: This place is just fun! It's a throwback to the 80s and 90s with vintage memorabilia scattered throughout the space. The design is simple, yet stunning. The wrap-around bar is crisp. Pay attention to the details in the art in the space too.  4) Location: It's in the bottom floor of a fancy apartment building called Novel South on the far end of Nacy Yard that it's almost in the Waterfront neighborhood, bridging two neighborhoods. It's Metro accessible and street parking nearby isn't too hard to find.  ABC Pony will soon be a destination. I have no doubt in that.

This is a small Asian and Italian restaurant in the Novel apartments. The menu is split with some Italian and some Asian dishes, so it's not really a fusion. The restaurant has a very fresh take on all their dishes. I had the egg drop soup which was very fresh with unique toppings. It was elevated compared to the egg drop soup you'd get at a typical Chinese restaurant. It is supposed to be themed around the 90s, but I didn't really get that from the decor or menu. The only 90s I could see were some VHS tapes above the bar. I would highly recommend this place for a chill date night or drinks with friends.
